body_html:
@andrewharp, @bazinac, @OverratedGman I tried suggested and here is what i got
First, when some of resolutions are hardcoded, thumbnails look good and application does not crash 🥇 from what i observed, more common res. like 320x240, 640x480, 1280x720, 1920x1080 work, less common like 480x320, 720x480 or 1088x1088 does not. So thanks for this suggestion! Unfortunately I'm not able to confirm if issue is only the resolution as none of "faulty" resolutions can be used on Galaxy S5 device.

For the hardware level, actually it works on the device with 2 and fails on device with level 1 (however it could by caused by the thumbnail size again)

Last thing, I was not able to make work the older version of camera class in current demo, however not sure if it is needed.

First, when some of resolutions are hardcoded, thumbnails look good and application does not crash 🥇  from what i observed, more common res. like 320x240, 640x480, 1280x720, 1920x1080 work, less common like 480x320, 720x480 or 1088x1088 does not. So thanks for this suggestion! Unfortunately I'm not able to confirm if issue is only the resolution as none of "faulty" resolutions can be used on Galaxy S5 device.
For the hardware level, actually it works on the device with 2 and fails on device with level 1 (however it could by caused by the thumbnail size again)
Last thing, I was not able to make work the older version of camera class in current demo, however not sure if it is needed.
body:
@andrewharp, @bazinac, @OverratedGman  I tried suggested and here is what i got
First, when some of resolutions are hardcoded, thumbnails look good and application does not crash :1st_place_medal:  from what i observed, more common res. like 320x240, 640x480, 1280x720, 1920x1080 work, less common like 480x320, 720x480 or 1088x1088 does not. So thanks for this suggestion! Unfortunately I'm not able to confirm if issue is only the resolution as none of "faulty" resolutions can be used on Galaxy S5 device.

For the hardware level, actually it works on the device with 2 and fails on device with level 1 (however it could by caused by the thumbnail size again)

Last thing, I was not able to make work the older version of camera class in current demo, however not sure if it is needed.
